McDonald's is stepping up its onslaught on Starbucks by introducing specially trained baristas and prominent coffee bars to its outlets across the US.

It is adding lattes, mochas and an ice-blended "frappe" to its menus, plus a broader range of "grab and go" beverages such as iced tea, smoothies and bottled drinks. According to internal documents obtained by the Wall Street Journal, executives believe the extra drinks could add $1bn (£500m) a year to McDonald's global sales of $21.6bn.

The strategy will increase pressure on Starbucks, which has seen its share price plunge by nearly 50% over the past year on concerns that it is expanding too fast. Starbucks had its nose put out of joint last year when Consumer Reports, a US magazine, gave McDonald's coffee a higher taste rating.

The changes will start in McDonald's 14,000 US branches, though improvements in Britain are also promised.
